intro: Chaetanthera, commonly known as the "velvet tassel" or "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their distinctive, often hairy or velvety leaves and clusters of small, greenish or yellowish flowers. Chaetanthera species are typically found in temperate regions and are known for their aromatic properties. They often grow in woodland or shaded areas, preferring moist, well-drained soils. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value.
